title: Inquiry-Based Mathematics Instructional Design in Self-Regulated Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Focuses on applying inquiry-based learning strategies in smartphone-based limited-technology environments for pre-service and in-service teachers

learning_goals: Predict, observe, explain, and evaluate mathematical problem-solving processes using an extended POEE scaffolding approach.
Independently perform inquiry-based mathematical learning in online environments by applying self-regulated learning strategies.

Learners exchange collaborative feedback with peers and instructors at least twice weekly using mobile digital tools (e.g., Google Jamboard, Padlet) and verify feedback implementation via a checklist (clarity, specificity, actionability).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
